quote: Cinema is the most beautiful fraud in the world.
author: Jean-Luc Godard

quote: If you want a happy ending, that depends, of course, on where you stop your story.
author: Orson Welles

quote: Cinema is a matter of what's in the frame and what's out.
author: Martin Scorsese

quote: I think cinema, movies, and magic have always been closely associated. The very earliest people who made film were magicians.
author: Francis Ford Coppola

quote: The sound and music are 50% of the entertainment in a movie.
author: George Lucas

quote: When people ask me if I went to film school I tell them, 'no, I went to films.'
author: Quentin Tarantino

quote: A film is - or should be - more like music than like fiction. It should be a progression of moods and feelings. The theme, what's behind the emotion, the meaning, all that comes later.
author: Stanley Kubrick

quote: Movies are like an expensive form of therapy for me.
author: Tim Burton

quote: You know what your problem is, it's that you haven't seen enough movies - all of life's riddles are answered in the movies.
author: Steve Martin

quote: Filmmaking is a chance to live many lifetimes.
author: Robert Altman

quote: Cinema should make you forget you are sitting in a theater.
author: Roman Polanski

quote: Pick up a camera. Shoot something. No matter how small, no matter how cheesy, no matter whether your friends and your sister star in it. Put your name on it as director. Now you're a director. Everything after that you're just negotiating your budget and your fee.
author: James Cameron

quote: Movies can and do have tremendous influence in shaping young lives in the realm of entertainment towards the ideals and objectives of normal adulthood.
author: Walt Disney

quote: The length of a film should be directly related to the endurance of the human bladder.
author: Alfred Hitchcock

quote: Acting is not about being famous, it's about exploring the human soul.
author: Annette Bening

quote: Everybody has something that chews them up and, for me, that thing was always loneliness. The cinema has the power to make you not feel lonely, even when you are.
author: Tom Hanks

quote: The most honest form of filmmaking is to make a film for yourself.
author: Peter Jackson

quote: Film lovers are sick people.
author: Francois Truffaut

quote: The difference between life and the movies is that a script has to make sense, and life doesn't.
author: Joseph L. Mankiewicz

quote: An actress is not a machine, but they treat you like a machine. A money machine.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: I made mistakes in drama. I thought drama was when actors cried. But drama is when the audience cries.
author: Frank Capra

quote: Every single art form is involved in film, in a way.
author: Sydney Pollack

quote: A film is a petrified fountain of thought.
author: Jean Cocteau

quote: It's the movies that have really been running things in America ever since they were invented. They show you what to do, how to do it, when to do it, how to feel about it, and how to look how you feel about it.
author: Andy Warhol

quote: Television is chewing gum for the eyes.
author: Frank Lloyd Wright

quote: Every great film should seem new every time you see it.
author: Roger Ebert

quote: We are the movies and the movies are us.
author: David Ansen

quote: Film spectators are quiet vampires.
author: Jim Morrison

quote: I do believe that movies are subject to a million interpretations.
author: Oliver Stone

quote: I don't take the movies seriously, and anyone who does is in for a headache.
author: Bette Davis

quote: Movies are a complicated collision of literature, theatre, music and all the visual arts.
author: Yahoo Serious

quote: I'm not a real movie star. I've still got the same wife I started out with twenty-eight years ago.
author: Will Rogers

quote: Movies are something people see all over the world because there is a certain need for it.
author: Wim Wenders

quote: If my films make one more person miserable, I'll feel I have done my job.
author: Woody Allen

quote: 'Home Alone' was a movie, not an alibi.
author: Jerry Orbach

quote: The secret to film is that it's an illusion.
author: George Lucas

quote: The most amazing thing for me is that every single person who sees a movie, not necessarily one of my movies, brings a whole set of unique experiences. Now, through careful manipulation and good storytelling, you can get everybody to clap at the same time, to hopefully laugh at the same time, and to be afraid at the same time.
author: Steven Spielberg

quote: The best reason to go to the movies is to be with other people. Eating the popcorn, being with other people you don't know.
author: Peter Weller

quote: I just like movies that somehow expose the world in a way that's different than you imagine it.
author: Alex Winter

quote: Movies are like magic tricks.
author: Jeff Bridges

quote: Shoot a few scenes out of focus. I want to win the foreign film award.
author: Billy Wilder

quote: If you're sitting in your minivan, playing your computer animated films for your children in the back seat, is it the animation that's entertaining you as you drive and listen? No, it's the storytelling. That's why we put so much importance on story. No amount of great animation will save a bad story.
author: John Lasseter

quote: I don't want to dress up a picture with just my face.
author: Grace Kelly

quote: It's the story that counts.
author: Vincente Minnelli

quote: A wide screen just makes a bad film twice as bad.
author: Samuel Goldwyn

quote: The great art of films does not consist of descriptive movement of face and body but in the movements of thought and soul transmitted in a kind of intense isolation.
author: Louise Brooks

quote: Everyone told me to pass on 'Speed' because it was a 'bus movie.'
author: Sandra Bullock

quote: Filmmaking can be a fine art.
author: Terri Windling

quote: Everything makes me nervous - except making films.
author: Elizabeth Taylor

quote: So I like to try to go back and develop pure visual storytelling. Because to me, it's one of the most exciting aspects of making movies and almost a lost art at this point.
author: Brian De Palma

quote: I never enjoyed working in a film.
author: Marlene Dietrich

quote: The end of a picture is always an end of a life.
author: Sam Peckinpah

quote: I don't storyboard. I guess it dates back to my days in live television, where there was no possibility of storyboarding and everything was shot right on the spot - on the air, as we say - at the moment we were transmitting. I prefer to be open to what the actors do, how they interact to the given situation.
author: Arthur Penn

quote: If I can't get the girl, at least give me more money.
author: Alan Alda

quote: I like the idea of movies having a magic element. How many times have you seen an actor in a movie who you know only as the character? It's wonderful, isn't it?
author: Christian Bale

quote: Learning to make films is very easy. Learning what to make films about is very hard.
author: George Lucas

quote: I like something where I can really use my imagination and be an active participant in the construction of the monster and usually that's in the world of the supernatural or the world of the fantastic, so that's why those kinds of stories about demons and the supernatural appeal to me or maybe I'm really interested in that subject.
author: Sam Raimi

quote: When I was growing up, Dr. Seuss was really my favorite. There was something about the lyrical nature and the simplicity of his work that really hit me.
author: Tim Burton

quote: You read a script and its based on 'Reservoir Dogs' and 'Pulp Fiction', and it goes right in the bin.
author: Tim Roth

quote: A story should have a beginning, a middle and an end, but not necessarily in that order.
author: Jean-Luc Godard
